titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Wyckoff House collection 1977.350
titlestmt.author: Robyn Hjermstad and Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:27 +0000.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York (N.Y.). Dept. of Parks and Recreation

did.abstract: This collection contains eleven Photostats of property maps and architectural drawings relating to property of the Wyckoff family in Flatlands. The maps and drawings detail original Wyckoff properties, purchases from Canarsie Indians, and other sales throughout the period 1628 to 1901. The Photostats date from 1973. Also included is The Wyckoff House: Its History and Structure by Oppenheimer, Brady, and Associates for the New York City Department of Parks and Recreation.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Wyckoff House collection, 1977.350, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Wyckoff family was a prominent Brooklyn family descended from Pieter Claesen Wyckoff, one of the most influential leaders during 17th-century settlement in New Amsterdam. Claesen-Wyckoff and his wife, Greitje van Ness, eventually settled in Flatlands, Brooklyn, in what is now the historic Wyckoff Homestead. Claesen-Wyckoff and his wife had a total of eleven children, who married into several different families, creating a vast and complex genealogy spanning the entire country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains eleven Photostats of property maps and architectural drawings relating to property of the Wyckoff family in Flatlands. The maps and drawings detail original Wyckoff properties, purchases from Canarsie Indians, and other sales throughout the period 1628 to 1901. The Photostats date from 1973. Also included is The Wyckoff House: Its History and Structure by Oppenheimer, Brady, and Associates for the New York City Department of Parks and Recreation.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related archival collections at the Brooklyn Historical Society:

list.item: 1973.258, Harriet Stryker-Rodda typescript of Peter Wyckoff recollections, 1828-1958
